title: John Oliver eviscerates Trump over Ukraine saga, mocks Nickelback Twitter flub
text:
CLOSE John Oliver came after Mike Pence with a surprise children’s book about a gay bunny Time

Late night host John Oliver got serious about the Ukraine whistleblower complaint against President Donald Trump and compared the president to a "Fox News-addled idiot" in his latest installment of "Last Week Tonight."

"Twitter removed one of the president's memes because Nickelback complained," Oliver said on the show Sunday, referring to Trump tweeting a clip of the band before it was taken down over copyright concerns. "That's a sentence that somehow suggests the news is now being written by an algorithm designed to generate random (expletive)."

He later referred to the Ukraine ordeal as "'Stupid Watergate II,' something that features everything that was bad about the original, while still somehow managing to be worse." Trump's Ukraine call and President Richard Nixon's Watergate scandal are increasingly drawing parallels. Nixon resigned in 1974 surrounding his involvement with covering up an attempted burglary of the Democratic party's Watergate office.

Trump is currently facing an impeachment inquiry after reportedly urging Ukraine and China's political leaders to investigate presidential rival, Joe Biden, and his son, Hunter Biden.

John Oliver's latest edition of "Last Week Tonight" tackled President Donald Trump's Ukraine whistleblower complaint. (Photo: Eric Liebowitz/HBO)

"While it should be clear why Trump's Ukraine dealings are bad, it is worth taking a second to reflect just how bad," Oliver said. "Because using your office to take down your political rivals is what dictators do. Trump asking China and Ukraine to do that should really bother us."

Oliver also criticized GOP leaders who continue to defend Trump.

"People act on his jokes," Oliver argued. "Russia took his whole 'help find Hillary's emails' routine pretty seriously. And shooting off his mouth now is significantly worse, because, you know, he's the president."

He continued: "If he was just any old Fox News-addled idiot ranting about how Biden should be investigated, that would be one thing. But he's not. He's the president. He has real power, and when he abuses it to keep himself in power, that's a big problem. ... It has to be illegal, and for good reason. Because unfortunately, not every foreign government will be as brave and willing to stand up to Trump as (expletive) Nickelback."
